alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 10:47AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm cluster will impact portions of Apache and Navajo Counties through 1115 AM MST near Shumway, Taylor, and Snowflake... At 1045 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms 7 miles east of Shumway, or 10 miles northeast of Show Low, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds of 40 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Taylor, Shumway, Snowflake and White Mountain Lake. This includes the following highways... State Route 277 between mile markers 327 and 336. State Route 77 between mile markers 343 and 365. Highway 60 between mile markers 343 and 356. State Route 61 between mile markers 353 and 362. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes. Strong outflow winds may not be accompanied by heavy rainfall. If out recreating on smaller waterways, head to shore!

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; White Mountains
